Sentencas: The presence of trace amounts of H2S in H-2-rich fuel poisons Ni-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes, adversely affecting the electrochemical performance.
Titulo: Ab Initio Adsorption Thermodynamics of H2S and H2 on Ni(111): The Importance of Thermal Corrections and Multiple Reaction Equilibria

Sentencas: This study uses density functional theory (DFT) to describe the competitive adsorption thermodynamics of H2S and H-2 on Ni(111).
Titulo: Ab Initio Adsorption Thermodynamics of H2S and H2 on Ni(111): The Importance of Thermal Corrections and Multiple Reaction Equilibria

Sentencas: Unlike previous DFT-based studies on the H2S-H-2-Ni system, a vibrational analysis of the adsorbates is performed to calculate the thermal corrections to the enthalpy and entropy of the surface species.
Titulo: Ab Initio Adsorption Thermodynamics of H2S and H2 on Ni(111): The Importance of Thermal Corrections and Multiple Reaction Equilibria

Sentencas: Parallel adsorption reactions of H-2 on Ni explicitly accounting for coverage effects of the S and H adatoms on the Ni(111) surface are included in the analysis.
Titulo: Ab Initio Adsorption Thermodynamics of H2S and H2 on Ni(111): The Importance of Thermal Corrections and Multiple Reaction Equilibria

Sentencas: The resulting equilibrium equations for the multiple adsorption/desorption reactions are then solved to calculate the S and H coverage over a wide range of T, P-H2S, and P-H2.
Titulo: Ab Initio Adsorption Thermodynamics of H2S and H2 on Ni(111): The Importance of Thermal Corrections and Multiple Reaction Equilibria

Sentencas: This study illustrates the errors introduced in the predicted S coverage if H-2 adsorption in parallel with H2S adsorption is neglected or if the thermal corrections to the enthalpy and entropy of reaction are not handled properly.
Titulo: Ab Initio Adsorption Thermodynamics of H2S and H2 on Ni(111): The Importance of Thermal Corrections and Multiple Reaction Equilibria
